description.narrative: (Philippines): Grievances arising from marginalization and discrimination, poor governance, poverty, and conflict have fueled violent extremism in Mindanao. The ENGAGE Activity will expand its work to reduce vulnerabilities to violent extremism by promoting good governance through collaborative activities that address grievances. ENGAGE will work with local governments to enhance their effectiveness (the supply side) and with civil society and citizens to deepen their understanding of how local governments function and how citizens can effectively express their needs and priorities (the demand side). It will bring together government officials and citizens from 20-30 highly vulnerable localities in Mindanao, build social cohesion and encourage interaction; develop local civil society networks, including those involving youth and women; strengthen mechanisms that advocate for public participation; and work with local actors to deliver social and economic services.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
